sense.def:
More
pomeni večje število ali količino kot prej ali kot nekaj drugega.

seg.quote: Do you spend more time teaching, or doing research?
Better management may enable one man to milk more cows.
He saw more than 800 children dying of starvation.
There are more of them seeking jobs than there are jobs available.

sense.def:
More
pomeni tudi v večjem obsegu.

seg.quote: The books that are true to life will attract them more.
They were more amused than concerned.

sense.def:
Kadar človek dela nekaj
some more
, dela tisto še naprej.

seg.quote: They talked a bit more.
I apologized and thought no more about it.
The employers don't want quality work any more.

sense.def:
More
se uporablja tudi za nekaj dodatnega.

seg.quote: In the next hour he found two more diamonds.
Have some more coffee, Vicar.
I wanted to find out more about her.

sense.def:
More
se uporablja pred pridevniki in prislovi za tvorbo primernika.

seg.quote: Your child's health is more important than the doctor's feelings.
Next time, I will choose more carefully.

sense.def:
Če nekaj ne drži
any more
, je nehalo držati.

seg.quote: The employers don't want quality work any more.
They're not here anymore.
He did not feel like working any more.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
more than a particular thing
, ima večjo vrednost ali pomen kot določena stvar.

seg.quote: It wasn't much more than a formality.
This is more than a hunter's job.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
more than
lahko tudi poudarimo, da je nekaj še bolj res, kot bi bilo treba ali kot je bilo rečeno.

seg.quote: You'll have more than enough money for any equipment you need.
This was a more than generous arrangement.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
more or less true
, je večinoma res, popolnoma pa ni.

seg.quote: Brian more or less implied that we were lying.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
what's more
uvedemo dodaten podatek, ki potrjuje ali poudarja tisto, kar trdimo.

seg.quote: What's more, he adds, there are no signs of a change.
